explains: adj. 坦率的，直言不讳的

sentences.en: She was outspoken in her criticism of the plan.
sentences.cn: 她对该计划的批评直言不讳。

sentences.en: His outspoken behaviour did not commend itself to his colleagues.
sentences.cn: 他直言不讳的行为不受他同事的欢迎。

sentences.en: He has made a string of outspoken and sometimes provocative speeches in recent years.
sentences.cn: 他最近几年做了一系列直言不讳的、有时带有挑衅的演说。
